ai-anya-e0902n0:207_1: Then the Buddha thought, “How do you think, sir? But what is the name of this teaching and training?” But how did you understand it?
ai-anya-e0902n0:209_0: Questioning this question about the Buddha:
ai-anya-e0902n0:210_1: In the Aṅgas, sir, there were a response of faith and confidence in the Vedas.
ai-anya-e0902n0:210_2: Many people spoke with confidence in the mendicant Saṅgha. They were attended on him with care.
ai-anya-e0902n0:210_3: In this statement, reverend Sir, is the story of the gods.
ai-anya-e0902n0:211_1: What things have been taught by the Buddha?
ai-anya-e0902n0:212_1: For the sake of conscience and prudence is pure, our livelihood is pure, our sense doors are pure, bright, finished, and supreme.
ai-anya-e0902n0:214_0: The Buddha has spoken about the Simile of the Man’s Follower
ai-anya-e0902n0:215_1: In that town, sir, there were a reference to the same town hall about those people.
ai-anya-e0902n0:216_1: And how do you practice in line with the Buddha’s instructions?
ai-anya-e0902n0:217_1: “When a mendicant doesn’t practice in line with the ascetic, covetousness, ill will, irritable, and hostility?”
ai-anya-e0902n0:217_2: And how does a mendicant practice in such a way that they have given up covetousness and ill will?
ai-anya-e0902n0:219_0: The Buddha’s question: Sāgata has spoken about what is spoken about?
ai-anya-e0902n0:220_1: In the Kosalan brahmins and householders there are householders called Sālā.
ai-anya-e0902n0:220_2: That’s the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
ai-anya-e0902n0:220_3: In this statement, reverend Sir, is the story of the gods.
ai-anya-e0902n0:222_0: But when the Buddha has asked questions about Verañjā:
ai-anya-e0902n0:223_1: The brahmins and householders of Sāvatthī spoke about the brahmins and householders.
ai-anya-e0902n0:223_2: That is the cause, brahmin, why some sentient beings are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
ai-anya-e0902n0:223_3: In this statement, reverend Sir, is the story of the gods.
ai-anya-e0902n0:225_0: Questioning in the Mahā Moggallāna asked: “Where did you say?
ai-anya-e0902n0:226_1: Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita was asked by Venerable Sāriputta.
ai-anya-e0902n0:228_0: The Shorter Classes in every way: “Where do you have spoken?
ai-anya-e0902n0:229_0: Now, sir, regarding questions that the lay followers were asked by the Dhammadinnā,
ai-anya-e0902n0:230_0: The Shorter Discourse on Taking Up Practices
ai-anya-e0902n0:231_0: The Question About the Sutta Regarding the Buddha about the Teaching, how many discourses were spoken by the Buddha?
ai-anya-e0902n0:232_0: To start out the intention of Sāvatthī:
ai-anya-e0902n0:233_0: The Longer Discourse on the Teaching
ai-anya-e0902n0:234_0: The Great Questioning asked this question about the Buddha himself:
ai-anya-e0902n0:235_0: To start out the intention of Sāvatthī:
ai-anya-e0902n0:237_0: But when questioned by the Buddha about the Simile of the Man’s statement, how many words about it?
ai-anya-e0902n0:238_0: To start out the intention of Sāvatthī:
ai-anya-e0902n0:241_1: The mendicants of Kosambī were responsible.
ai-anya-e0902n0:241_2: Sir, the mendicants of Kosambī were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words.
ai-anya-e0902n0:241_3: In this statement, reverend Sir, is the story of the gods.
ai-anya-e0902n0:243_0: Questioning about the Simile of the Brahmajāla Sutta in the Spheres about the Buddha?
ai-anya-e0902n0:244_0: To start out the intention of Sāvatthī:
ai-anya-e0902n0:247_1: In the land of the Bhaggas on Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna’s statement.
ai-anya-e0902n0:247_2: Māra the Wicked had got inside Moggallāna’s belly.
ai-anya-e0902n0:247_3: In this statement, reverend Sir, is the story of the gods.
